title: Take a Chance on Me on NYE: A Post-Midnight NYE Disco Dance Party
description: Keep the good times going until the last dance at Littlefield’s post-midnight party, where DJ Dandelion will be spinning hits from the ’70s and beyond.
cost: $8 (free admission for ticket holders of the 9pm Abba Lang Syne New Year’s Celebration)

title: Breweries and Taprooms
description: Have a hoppy brew year at one of NYC's many breweries and taprooms. Free admission unless noted. Bohemian Hall and Beer Garden (Astoria) has $25-40 for the 'Silent Disco Beer Garden Bash' 9pm-1am.
address: Bohemian Hall and Beer Garden, Fifth Hammer Brewing Co, Kings County Brewers Collective, Other Half, Strong Rope Brewery, Threes Brewing

title: NYE at Barcade
description: Race into the new year at Barcade. The arcade bar is tapping rare and obscure beers (available for purchase) and offering a free champagne toast at midnight. Free admission, game prices vary.

title: Times Square Ball Drop
description: Concerts! Confetti! Crowds! Test your stamina at the annual Times Square New Year’s Eve ball drop event. Free admission.

title: Best Year Ever! Comedy Show
description: Host Jenny Gorelick and a lineup of 25 comedians present their best bits of the year one last time at Union Hall (Park Slope) before heading into 2025. Attendees are welcome to stay for the venue's NYE party on both floors following the show at no additional charge.

title: Q.E.D. New Year’s Eve Spectacular Comedy Showcases
description: Laugh 'Happy New Year' one last time before Q.E.D. changes ownership in March. Tonight's lineups include Christian Finnegan, Keenan Steiner, Kenice Mobley, Anthony Devito, Calvin Cato, Kitty Reynolds, Kristal Adams, and others. Note: the 6pm show is open to ages 13+, and the 10pm show includes a screening of the Times Square ball drop and a champagne toast.

title: New Year’s Eve Contra
description: Promenade and sashay into the new year at Brooklyn Contra’s eighth annual New Year’s social dance. Led by caller Will Mentor and featuring live music by New England-based trio Stomp Rocket, the evening includes a beginner lesson at 8pm, snacks, and a champagne toast at midnight.

title: New Year’s Eve Country-Oke Bonanza
description: Take the stage with a four-piece band backing you up at honky tonk bar Skinny Dennis’s country music karaoke night. Admission includes a mystery shot at midnight.

title: Royal Palms Shuffleboard’s Flamingo Formal
description: Start 2025 off with a tang (cue stick) at Royal Palms Shuffleboard’s annual Flamingo Formal. Free admission. Optional court times are available for purchase on site. A $125 package includes a five-hour unlimited drink wristband and a sandwich.

title: Rubulad Presents: The Fancy Pants Ball
description: Don your most dazzling duds and get ready to dance your pants off at underground art party thrower Rubulad’s NYE party. Featuring live music, DJs, go-go, visuals, and more. Themed dress encouraged. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.

title: New York Night Train’s 16th Annual New Year’s Ball
description: Jonathan Toubin’s New York Night Train party returns to TV Eye (Bushwick/Ridgewood), featuring six bands and 14 DJs filling three rooms with 12-hours of non-stop music. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.

title: Citysoul Drum + Bass New Year’s Eve
description: Indie arcade Wonderville hosts a night of gaming and bouncing breaks. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.

title: Barn Burner NYE Country Dance Party
description: Olivia Ellen Lloyd and band burn it all down with three hours of honky tonk, dancing, and carrying on at Jalopy Theater. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.
address: Jalopy Theater, Columbia Street Waterfront District

title: Abba Lang Syne New Year’s Celebration
description: NYC’s spot-on Abba tribute band returns to Littlefield for a NYE disco party. $30 adv, $40 day of (ticket includes admission to the Take a Chance on Me on after party listed at 12:30am below).

title: End Times III: Doomsday Disco
description: It’s apocalypse now at Purgatory’s third annual party for the end of the world, featuring musical performances, DJs, drag, and a pre-party happy hour with flash tats and a photo booth. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight. Dress code: apocalypse chic.

title: The Uncommons New Year’s Eve
description: Roll with it at The Uncommons board game cafe’s annual after-hours party, featuring a wide library of games to play and snacks and drinks available for purchase. Admission includes a sparkling wine toast at midnight.

title: NYE Silent Disco Beer Garden Bash
description: Take your pick from three DJs spinning different genres into your wireless headphones (provided) at Astoria’s Bohemian Hall and Beer Garden. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.
address: Bohemian Hall and Beer Garden, Astoria

title: New Year’s Eve Dance Party at Parklife
description: Dance into 2025 with DJs Marc Bars, Trauma, and Mikey Palms as they play the best of 80’s and 90’s pop and hip hop, with a mix of hits through the decades, at Parklife, a modern taqueria inspired by Persian, Mexican, and Texan flavors.

title: Hot Rabbit’s Resolutions LGBTQ+ New Year’s Eve Party
description: Hot Rabbit's big queer NYE party takes over Brooklyn Monarch with DJs, drag, burlesque, and live vocal and dance performances. Food will be available for purchase. Bonus: door prizes for best dressed. Admission includes a champagne toast at midnight.

title: Time’s Up! Annual New Year’s Eve Bike Ride and After Party
description: Celebrate a future positive New Year’s Eve by joining in a group bike/skate to Central Park’s Belvedere Castle. NYC direct action environmental organization Time’s Up’s annual ride has three meet-up locations and culminates in an outdoor dance party.

title: New Year’s Eve Celebration in Prospect Park
description: Gather at Brooklyn’s Grand Army Plaza for live music and a festive light show display. Note: the light show is weather dependent and as of press time was pending FCC approvals.

title: A Concert to Usher in the New Year
description: Surround yourself in the majestic sounds of a 12,000-pipe Aeolian-Skinner organ at this annual NYE concert, performed by Paolo Bordignon at St. Bartholomew Church. Admission includes a champagne reception at midnight.

title: When Harry Met Sally Screenings
description: Relive the NYE party reunion of Meg Ryan and Billy Crystal at screenings of Nora Ephron and Rob Reiner’s 1989 romantic comedy When Harry Met Sally at Village East by Angelika (12/30 7pm, 8pm, 9:30pm), Cinema 123 by Angelika (12/30 7pm), and Syndicated (12/31 5:20pm + 10:25pm).
address: Village East by Angelika, Cinema 123 by Angelika, Syndicated
